> > > 抛出异常 dubbo.remoting.RemotingException: message can not send, because channel is closed
> 
> this high probability feels that there is no graceful shutdown.

通过ctrl + c结束了provider进程，从日志看provider端是正常关闭了。但是consumer端的HeaderExchangeClient并没有。
org.apache.dubbo.rpc.protocol.dubbo.DubboProtocol#checkClientCanUse的这行代码
if (referenceCountExchangeClient == null || referenceCountExchangeClient.isClosed()) {
                return false;
 }
为什么不用!referenceCountExchangeClient.isConnected()判断呢，实际上这个channel已经disconnect了，但是没有close。
现在我用AddressListener给每个consumer的url都加上了send.reconnect=true这个参数，可以解决这个问题。
有其他可以配置send.reconnect=true的地方吗，对性能应该没有损失吧？

Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments?utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=The+Apache+Software+Foundation).

For this issue, there are two aspects we need to consider as follows

+ **XML configuration supports lazy initialization or not**

  For XML configuration, we need to consider `default-lazy-init` in `beans` and `lazy-init` in the specified `bean`,  see them as below:

  ```java
  <beans xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xmlns:dubbo="http://dubbo.apache.org/schema/dubbo"
         xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans-4.3.xsd
      http://dubbo.apache.org/schema/dubbo http://dubbo.apache.org/schema/dubbo/dubbo.xsd" default-lazy-init="true"> // default-lazy-init
  
      <dubbo:application name="application"/>
  
      <!-- service configuration -->
      <dubbo:service interface="org.apache.dubbo.config.spring.api.DemoService" ref="demoService"/>
  		// lazy-init for the specified bean
      <bean id="demoService" class="org.apache.dubbo.config.spring.impl.DemoServiceImpl" lazy-init="true"/>
  
  </beans>
  ```

  If the `bean` is referenced by `dubbo:service` , which cannot be lazy initialized no matter `default-lazy-init` or `lazy-init` sets `true`, because `dubbo:service` don't support lazy initialization.

  `DubboBeanDefinitionParser` will parse all beans like `dubbo:xxx`. There seems to be no problem here, if all of them don't support lazy initialization(there are no `lazy-init` attribute).

  ```java
  RootBeanDefinition beanDefinition = new RootBeanDefinition();
  beanDefinition.setBeanClass(beanClass);
  beanDefinition.setLazyInit(false); // There is no problem here, beause all of dubbo:xxx bean don't support lazy-init attribute
  ```
We can dissucss if all of `dubbo:xxx ` beans need to support `lazy-init` attribute

+ **Annotation configuration supports lazy initialization or not**

  I have tested that Lazy annotation don't support and I have fix this issue. see #7981

READY_TO_CLOSE

> If the providers in the cluster expose different retries values for the same method, which one does the consumer rely on?
> 
> Because of the characteristics of Failover Cluster, we can only rely on the current consumer. Is this correct?

This is also a problem.

@shenyanming95 In FailoverClusterInvoker, the retries are obtained before the provider is called, so the value can only be obtained from the consumer. However, if the retries are obtained based on the url of the invoker during the call, it may be because the configuration of each provider is different , The number of retries in the call is uncertain. So I agree with cnjxzhao's point of view.

> > There are some suggestions as follows:
> > We don't need to define new parameters export-async and refer-async, we can make exportServices and referServices asynchronous
> > We don't to define different ThreadPools. In most cases, only one of serviceExporterExecutor and serviceRefererExecutor will work, because it is less likely that a service is both a service and a reference. We'd better design an shared ThreadPool to handle all temporary tasks
> 
> I think these are very good suggestions we should take into consideration.

1、We don't need to define new parameters export-async and refer-async, we can make exportServices and referServices asynchronous

We can consider to set async as default mode, but I think we still need these parameters.

2、We don't to define different ThreadPools. In most cases, only one of serviceExporterExecutor and serviceRefererExecutor will work, because it is less likely that a service is both a service and a reference. We'd better design an shared ThreadPool to handle all temporary tasks

I have done that.

> If move `ConsumerContextClusterInterceptor` back to Filter, is `ConsumerContextFilter` or `ConsumerContextClusterInterceptor` duplicated?
> 
> We have added it a filter(be activated with parameter) to fix this.
> 
> What is the `ConsumerContextClusterInterceptor` class used for? Multi registry or what else?

just remove `ConsumerContextClusterInterceptor`
